title: I.Sicily inscription 003372
support: A funerary altar, somewhat eroded on all faces. Quadrangular in form, with triple moulding at the top of the main block, surmounted by scrolls on each side with a central horn, and a raised square block on the upper surface behind the horn. The front face of the altar has relief designs on the lower half, which may relate to milling, and a relief form of a tabula ansata on the upper part, which contains a Greek funerary inscription. The right side carries further relief designs showing tools associated with crafts.

layout.p: The text is set out within a tabula ansata, 26 cm x 18 cm, and heavily eroded, over four lines

handNote.lettering: Lunate sigma and epsilon, but little detail is visible.

provenanceFound._: Recovered on the line of the railway, approx. 2.5km north of Priolo Gargallo, near the southern edge of Megara Hyblaea (so Orsi)

graphics.desc: Photo J. Prag (2013), Aut. Assessorato Beni Culturali Regione Siciliana n.10681 del 06/05/2014

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi
museum.description: An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.
